text: Easily my least played Mario Kart game on home consoles, but I won't deny it had some great new tracks. DK Summit was probably my favorite one. One thing's for sure, I will never like playing MK with motion controls.
author: SupraDarky

text: For me it's the opposite, because of the time it came out it's the MK i played the most and also i managed to clear it with the motion controls with 3 stars on all cups, because i'm a stubborn idiot and didn't know you could change the control settings. I still find the motion controls more managable than the first person mode from 7.
author: Duskool

text: Your point of view is definitely more popular than mine, I do know tons of people who have this as their most played in the series and even loving the motion controls!
author: SupraDarky

text: Duskool 3 stars on all cups with motion controls 😮 ur a psycho hahah congrats
author: simongamer987

text: @simongamer987 I know right? Haha, so many blue shells were thrown at me during that time.
author: Duskool

text: @SupraDarky What's your most played MK then?
author: Duskool

text: This game with GameCube controls is the best experience on this saga, the only thing near is Mario kart 64, but it's the best imo
author: Tomás Palazzi

text:
I've played all the games except 64 and the arcade one. 8 is the best by a landslide, I was really suprised to find that I dislike double dash. I expected so much more from that based on it's reputation before I completed it last year.
I actually sort of enjoyed the motion controls in MK 7, they felt a lot better than the wii. My first impression of MK wii was that it sucked, but after I played it with analog controls I found it to be okay.
author: King Blank

text: @SupraDarky When you say "tracks" in this context, do you mean racing tracks or music tracks? ^^ And I think MK Wii is easily the least well regarded entry in the series. But I haven't even played it, even though I played every other entry, including both arcade ones.
author: Burkhart von Klitzing

text: Most played mariokart game. Enjoy the world clan league so much. It was able to play with gamecube controller so it was perfect.
author: Kick Me

text: Also maple treeway en mushroom gorge were awesome tracks. Daisy circuit and koopa cape were pretty good too!
author: Kick Me

text: Burkhart von Klitzing Huh, I wonder where you got from that Mario Kart Wii could be the least well regarded entry in the series. :P In my experience, Mario Kart Wii is the most played one, Mario Kart 8 is the highest rated one, Mario Kart Super Circuit is the least played one, and Super Mario Kart is the lowest rated one. But I guess it might depend on what videos you watch! ;)

Kill me if you want, but this is my favourite MKWii track.

I like it 50% because of boost pads,
And I like it 50% because of the music.

Oh, and MKWii's my favourite MK game, so call it my favourite track of all time if you want.

text: I think Nintendo just throws a dart at a board with all the Mario characters in it and whomever it lands on becomes the proprietary of that particular installment's ice course.  It happened twice with DK (DS, Wii), once for Rosalina (7), and once now for Wario (8, 8 Deluxe)
